    Indicator definitions

    definitions.Rmd

    This is a quick attempt at creating standardized definitions of many of the indicators we use. For example, the question about the condition of local parks is a Likert-style question with answers of strongly agree, somewhat agree, somewhat disagree, strongly disagree. When we report this indicator, however, we do it as the percentage that says either strongly or somewhat agree. The data frame cws_defs has definitions of each indicator of this type, how the question was phrased, and the definition of what responses get collapsed into the summary indicator.

    #> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

    Here’s how one of these Likert questions is defined. It doesn’t have anything special to it, so the universe and calculation columns are blank:

    indicator question collapsed_responses universe calculation
    safe biking there are places to bicycle in or near my neighborhood that are safe from traffic such as on the street or on special lanes separate paths or trails Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA

    A few questions are more complicated, and have different universes to use. For example, current smoking rate is calculated based on the percentage of people who say they’ve smoked 100 cigarettes in their life; that becomes the universe for the share of people who say they currently smoke every day or some days:

    indicator question collapsed_responses universe calculation
    smoked 100 cigs have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes in your entire life Yes NA NA
    currently smoke do you currently smoke cigarettes every day some days or not at all Every day, Some days smoked 100 cigs currently smoke * smoked 100 cigs

    Here’s the whole data frame as reference:

    indicator question collapsed_responses universe calculation
    stores in walking distance many stores banks markets or places to go are within easy walking distance of my home Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    safe sidewalks there are safe sidewalks and crosswalks on most of the streets in my neighborhood Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    safe biking there are places to bicycle in or near my neighborhood that are safe from traffic such as on the street or on special lanes separate paths or trails Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    affordable rec facilities my neighborhood has several free or low cost recreation facilities such as parks playgrounds public swimming pools etc Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    safe walking at night i do not feel safe to go on walks in my neighborhood at night Strongly disagree, Somewhat disagree NA NA
    trust neighbors people in this neighborhood can be trusted Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    youth have positive role models children and youth in my town generally have the positive role models they need around here Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    neighbors would save fire station if the fire station closest to your home was going to be closed down by your city or town how likely is it that neighborhood residents would organize to try to do something to keep the fire station open Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    excellent or very good self rated health the next set of questions are about your health how would you rate your overall health would you say your health is excellent very good good fair or poor Excellent, Very good NA NA
    satisfied with life overall how satisfied are you with your life nowadays Mostly satisfied, Completely satisfied NA NA
    happy overall how happy did you feel yesterday Mostly, Completely NA NA
    anxious overall how anxious did you feel yesterday Mostly, Completely NA NA
    leisure time overall to what extent do you have the time you need to do things that you really enjoy Mostly, Completely NA NA
    no personal doctor do you have one person or place you think of as your personal doctor or health care provider No NA NA
    no medical home is that because you have more than one personal doctor or none at all None at all no personal doctor None at all * no personal doctor
    depressed (old phrasing) during the last month how often have you been bothered by feeling down depressed or hopeless would you say Very often, Fairly often NA NA
    local govt is responsive how responsive local government is to the needs of residents Excellent, Good NA NA
    goods and services available the availability of the goods and services that meet your needs Excellent, Good NA NA
    approve of police the job done by the police to keep residents safe Excellent, Good NA NA
    suitable employment opportunities the ability of residents to obtain suitable employment Excellent, Good NA NA
    good to raise kids as a place to raise children Excellent, Good NA NA
    parks in good condition the condition of public parks and other public recreational facilities Excellent, Good NA NA
    smoked 100 cigs have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes in your entire life Yes NA NA
    currently smoke do you currently smoke cigarettes every day some days or not at all Every day, Some days smoked 100 cigs currently smoke * smoked 100 cigs
    financially insecure how well would you say you are managing financially these days would you say you are Just getting by, Finding it difficult, Finding it very difficult NA NA
    labor force have you had a paid job in the last 30 days Yes, No but would like to work NA NA
    unemployed have you had a paid job in the last 30 days No but would like to work labor force no / labor force
    employed have you had a paid job in the last 30 days Yes labor force yes / labor force
    work part time during this time has your job been full time or part time Part time employed Part time * employed
    prefer full time are you working parttime by choice or would you rather have a fulltime job Rather have a full time job work part time Rather have full time * work part time
    underemployed are you working parttime by choice or would you rather have a fulltime job NA labor force unemployed + prefer full time
    access to car do you have access to a car when you need it would you say you have access Very often, Fairly often NA NA
    people improving neighborhood people in this neighborhood are involved in trying to improve the neighborhood Strongly agree, Somewhat agree NA NA
    get social support how often do you get the social and emotional support you need Always, Usually NA NA
    little interest little interest or pleasure in doing things More than half the days, Nearly every day NA NA
    depressed feeling down depressed or hopeless More than half the days, Nearly every day NA NA
    affordable produce the availability of affordable highquality fruits and vegetables Excellent, Good NA NA
